column1: What do you call a matador who lost to the bull? a matogore.
column3: A matador is a bullfighter, and the pun plays on the word gore.
column4: The matador bravely faced the bull in the ring, showcasing his skill and courage.
column5: The story of the defeated matador became a tale of tragedy that was filled with emotional gore.

column1: I told a joke to my chemistry teacher. he replied oh man, i slapped my neon that one.
column3: Neon is a chemical element and represents brightness.
column4: The neon sign lit up brilliantly, casting colorful reflections across the street.
column5: The neon lights pulsated with energy, creating an atmosphere of excitement in the club.

column1: What do nails like to do on the weekend? get hammered.
column3: To get hammered refers to drinking alcohol or hammering nails into wood.
column4: The carpenter hammered the nails into the wooden frame securely.
column5: After a long week, he decided to get hammered at the bar with friends to unwind.

column1: Did the deer have any doe? he had 2 bucks.
column3: Bucks refer to male deer as well as colloquially meaning money.
column4: The bucks leaped gracefully through the forest, showcasing their agility.
column5: After saving diligently, he had finally accumulated enough bucks to buy a new car.
